title: @Riot, Please make Shyvana immune to CC while performing Dragon's Descent
body:
It's incredibly frustrating that a lot of champions can simply stop her attempts at initiating a fight. Malphite, Hecarim, and Jarvan all have more impactful initiation ults that make them CC immune while performing them. Yet Shyvana's is much less reliable compared to any of them.

Dragon's descent has very spotty CC that sometimes completely ignores enemies who are standing in the way, and it's also easily interrupted. A change that would greatly improve the quality of life without changing damage numbers would be to make her CC immune for the duration of the leap.

I don't understand why people think Shyvana is an "engage tank", she's not, not even close. Her ult isn't a reliable engage because that's not what she is balanced around currently. Shyvana is in the same ball park as Xin Zhao or Tryndamere, except she is more easily kited, tankier, has no CC at all, BUT she does a shitton of % health damage AND she can do it in an AoE.

If ANYTHING they need to make her ult have a faster travel time, but tacking on reliable CC to it can't work unless they completely rework her. 

Honestly if riot buffed BoRK which is kind of weak atm I think Shyvana would do a lot better, but I'm not certain.

Trynd and xin Zhao are also absolute garbage, so it's not a bad comparison. Her cc attached to her ult is very small, and the ult is mostly used to reposition anyways. It's absolutely vital to her success that she gets where she needs to get with it, because she has little contingency. Her hitbox swells to such a size and she travels so slowly, it's very hard to actually complete an ult in a teamfight. I could understand this needing to be the case back when sated devourer was a thing, but its removal severely gimped her damage so shes now just all risk and no reward. And it's frankly kind of ludicrous she doesn't get any real love while hecarim is running around doing more damage with more mobility with better utility, clearing nearly as fast for only being slightly squishier.

I think it should be the other way around, remove the annoying CC immunity from these champions, or only give them tenacity.

Why? They do get CC'ed after the ultimate has finished casting
Giving them Tenacity while casting would just make the CC wear off faster while they are still in ult animation (though of course that would make knock ups and such even stronger as those things could now stop those ultimates on top of not being being removed by cleanse/QSS and not being reduced by tenacity)

Why? Because it's arbitrarily assigned to champions and makes no sense.

Zac's  theme is a lot like Hecarims or Malphites. So why can I as Janna force zac to flash >95% of the times he wants to engage on me as long as I'm paying attention?

And if that's fair, why isn't it allowed with Malphite or Hecarims engages?

It isn't arbitrary though... as pretty much the only dashes that are allowed to be immune to CC/impossible to stop (except for killing the champion) are ultimates which usually have a pretty long cooldown... while Zac dash is a normal ability with much shorter cooldown
I would rather see something different, and not just another "cc immune while performing engage ult"
